strengths_deep_dive: HHRD's financial health is characterized by consistent growth and rigorous oversight. The organization achieved a <cite id="15">3-year revenue CAGR of 8.2%</cite>, growing from $80.3 million in 2021 to <cite id="5">$94.0 million in 2023</cite>. rich_narrative.summary: Helping Hand for Relief and Development (HHRD) is a global humanitarian organization that has served vulnerable populations since its <cite id="1">founding in 1998</cite>. The organization specializes in integrating resources to provide <cite id="2">immediate disaster response</cite> alongside long-term developmental programs such as orphan support, healthcare, and skills training. HHRD maintains an exceptional financial profile, evidenced by a <cite id="3">perfect 100/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, a distinction it has held for <cite id="4">over 10 consecutive years</cite>. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization reported <cite id="5">total revenue of $94,048,415</cite>, demonstrating significant scale and the ability to manage large-scale relief operations. A hallmark of HHRD’s operational model is its high efficiency; the charity maintains a <cite id="6">program expense ratio of 91.2%</cite>, ensuring that the vast majority of donor funds reach the field. Furthermore, its fundraising operations are highly optimized, costing only <cite id="7">$0.06 to raise every $1</cite>. Beyond emergency aid, HHRD operates specialized facilities like <cite id="8">Comprehensive Rehabilitation Centers</cite> for persons with disabilities and provides <cite id="9">sponsorship for thousands of orphans</cite> globally. As a <cite id="10">zakat-eligible organization</cite>, it provides a verified pathway for Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations through programs that serve the <cite id="11">poor and needy (fuqara and masakin)</cite> across more than a dozen countries including Pakistan, Jordan, and Haiti.
